title: A Simple Explanation for the Culture War
description:
What causes a culture war? Once you understand some of the sociological reasons why culture wars happen, it will forever change the way you see The Culture War.

https://www.patreon.com/deeptalkstheologypodcast

transcript_parts.text: unless you live in a remote
hunter-gatherer tribe you're never just
part of one culture
you have macro cultures like American
culture or Western culture you have
subcultures like Midwestern culture
Evangelical culture Sports culture and
you also have Micro cultures and local
cultures like the culture of your
neighborhood school or family the
culture of your local church or the
company you work for each of these micro
local and subcultures are constantly
interacting with the dominant macro
cultures guiding story values symbols
and Customs but what happens when a
microculture or subculture emerges which
has a different guiding story and values
from the dominant macro culture either
there's a minimum threshold of shared
values identified in a negotiation and
synthesis of updated guiding stories
values symbols and practices emerge if
that's the case the macro culture may
still remain as the dominant culture for
that geography traffic location but it
has now become something slightly
different than what it was and so has
the subculture who was vying for more of
a share in the broader cultural
hierarchy another potential outcome of
diverse cultural interaction is that the
cultures find too much dissonance
between their guiding stories values
symbols and customs and a competition
between the dominant macro culture and
the emerging subculture takes place
the sharper the dissonance the more
likely this competition devolves into a
culture War where synthesis and
compromise no longer becomes an option
for either side instead both sides Vie
to either retain or usurped the Throne
of cultural power and assimilate the
other in an even worst case scenario the
hopes of even cultural assimilation come
off the table and sides move towards the
annihilation of the people of those
cultures this is why I take the culture
war in America so seriously it's not
just political theater it's very very
serious our attraction to particular
sides in the culture War are part of a
dynamic interplay between the inherited
personality predispositions we have and
the Learned values of the cultures we've
inhabited if you're genetically
hardwired to be high in openness
you probably aren't going to fit in well
in a fundamentalist microculture or
subculture of any kind if you're
genetically hardwired to be very orderly
and conscientious then in America you're
statistically more likely to be
politically conservative and live in the
suburbs or rural areas if you're single
college educated female who lives in a
densely populated urban area you
probably don't own a mega hat
at least one step towards reducing
hostilities and navigating diverse
cultural tensions is the humble
acknowledgment that if you were born
with the same genetic personality
predispositions and if you grew up in
the same cultures as your enemy
you'd probably have the same views that
they do this doesn't solve the
challenges of Divergent values
engagement but it does humanize the
other person
and that's an important step towards
reducing the likelihood of a culture War
devolving into a civil war
